content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for the bold word

content.question: Marla found it hard to empathize with people whose experiences were so different from her own.
Since Molly was soaking wet when she arrived, Aidan inferred that it was raining outside.
Diabetes often manifests itself as a persistent thirst.
George’s skilled artist’s eye could see the nuances that separated sage green from moss green.
Though she knew it would never be published, Cynthia spent years working on her treatise on junk food through the ages.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for the bold word

content.question: Cody kept a positive attitude even when faced with adversity.
Simon had a few cardinal rules for borrowing his books.
Max’s explanation for why the chair was on the roof was not credible.
Although Sabra had never been to New York before, she had an intuitive feeling that this city would be a great fit for her.
Josh found the competition so harrowing that even though he won, he vowed never to do it again.

content.question: Which of the following would not be one of a person’s faculties?
You might draw an inference based on what?
“Blue jeans never seem to go out of vogue” means that they are always
Which of these is most likely to be an impairment to a quick vacation abroad?

options: the loser of a tennis match

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: With today’s technology, it is possible to earn a college degree without ever stepping onto a college campus or attending class in person. Online learning is a good option, but those considering this idea should be careful.

While many well-respected colleges and universities have online courses that are taught by excellent faculty, the for-profit online-education industry doesn’t have the same kind of credibility. It has been discovered that several have included pernicious lies in their advertising about job-placement rates to attract more students.

A student who has chosen to attend such an online college, and who then graduates expecting to find a job easily, may instead go through the harrowing experience of not being able to find a job to pay off his or her college loans. Students are wise to be cautious and trust their intuition if they sense something isn’t right about an online college and its promises.

content.question: In line 6, faculty means
In line 8, the word credibility most nearly means
The meaning of pernicious (line 9) is
The word harrowing (line 13) most nearly means
The meaning of intuition (line 15) is
